meanings.definition: In a royal or kingly manner.
meanings.sent1: The queen waved regally to her subjects from the balcony.
meanings.sent2: He walked regally down the grand staircase of the palace.
meanings.sent3: The cat sauntered regally across the room, pretending to be a royal feline.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood regally in the center of the forest, a silent king among the greenery.
meanings.sent5: The sun set regally over the horizon, painting the sky in hues of gold and pink.

meanings.definition: Befitting or characteristic of a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The king wore a regally adorned crown on his head.
meanings.sent2: The regally decorated throne gleamed in the candlelight.
meanings.sent3: The regally dressed guests at the ball danced with grace and elegance.
meanings.sent4: The regally appointed chambers of the castle exuded an air of grandeur and opulence.
meanings.sent5: The regally carved coat of arms displayed the noble lineage of the family for generations to come.
